intro: Psychotria multipedunculata, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround small white flowers, making it visually distinctive. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
